qas.question: What has been used to connect digital cameras. smartphones and other devices to tablet computers?
What was standard for transferring data to and from the earlier type of smartphones?
How large are both mini-A and mini-B plugs?
When were the mini-A connector and and the mini-AB receptacle connector depreceated?

context: <a0_0>Various connectors<a0_0/> have been used for smaller devices such as digital cameras, smartphones, and tablet computers. These include the now-deprecated (i.e. de-certified but standardized) mini-A and mini-AB connectors; mini-B connectors are still supported, but are not OTG-compliant (On The Go, used in mobile devices). <a1_0>The mini-B USB connector<a1_0/> was standard for transferring data to and from the early smartphones and PDAs. Both mini-A and mini-B plugs are <a2_0>approximately 3 by 7 mm<a2_0/>; the mini-A connector and the mini-AB receptacle connector were deprecated on <a3_0>23 May 2007<a3_0/>.
